abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Senior
            Executive Service Project for Liberia is to provide the
            senior managerial and professional staff to key ministries,
            to increase high level capacity and lead reform and
            restructuring for better policy making, regulation and
            improved service delivering. The extension is necessary to
            extend the closing date of the project from December 31,
            2010 to June 30, 2011; and to re-allocate the sum of
            US$60,000 from the recurrent costs expenditure category of
            the project to goods, consultancy and training expenditure
            category. This extension will give the recipient the
            opportunity to continue to benefit from the services of the
            Senior Executive Service (SES) professionals for an
            additional period of six months. This extra time will help
            to compensate for the delays in implementation suffered as a
            result of weak project management capacity at the beginning
            of the project. This capacity issue has since been addressed
            by the replacement of the national project coordinator, with
            a more experienced project manager. None of the changes will
            have a major effect on the original economic, financial,
            technical, or social aspects of the project as appraised;
            nor will they raise the environmental category of the
            project or trigger new safeguard policies. A re-appraisal
            will therefore not be needed. Finally, the changes will
            involve no exceptions to bank policy.
